page.title: 06The Hotel
page.content: There has been a hotel in Cairndow for about 200 years.It is called the Stage Coach Inn because they used to change the horses there after coming over the Rest and Be Thankful. In the hotel there are eight workers and three of them are full time.There are ten rooms in the hotel.There is a bar and a restaurant a jacuzzi and a sunbed.There are solar panels to heat the water. The busiest time of year is June to August because of the fishing,the Cowal Games and the English holidays. A weekend for two would cost Â£70 for bed breakfast and dinner. In the hotel there are wedding receptions,folk nights,discos and dances.
